__init__(k, nu=None, to_do=None, param_mat=None, low_extrap=None, high_extrap=None, n_pad=None, verbose=False, simple=False, max_cache_size_mb=500)[source]

inputs: * k grid * the to_do list: e.g. one_loop density density , bias terms, … * low_extrap is the call to extrapolate the power spectrum to lower k-values,

this helps with edge effects

  • n_pad is the number of zeros to add to both ends of the array. This helps with

    edge effects.

  • verbose is to turn on verbose settings.

cleft_Q_R(P, P_window=None, C_window=None)[source]
compute_term(term, X, operation=None, P=None, P_window=None, C_window=None)[source]

FPTHandler Class

class fastpt.FPTHandler(fastpt_instance: FASTPT, do_cache=False, save_all=None, save_dir=None, max_cache_entries=500, **params)[source]
__init__(fastpt_instance: FASTPT, do_cache=False, save_all=None, save_dir=None, max_cache_entries=500, **params)[source]
bulk_run(func_names, power_spectra, verbose=False, **override_kwargs)[source]

Runs multiple functions with multiple power spectra.

Parameters:

  • func_names (list) – List of FASTPT function names to call

  • power_spectra (list) – List of power spectra to use

  • **override_kwargs – Additional parameters to pass to all function calls

Returns:

Results keyed by (function_name, power_spectrum_index)

Return type:

dict

clear_cache(function_name=None)[source]

Clears specific or all cached results.

clear_default_params()[source]
property fastpt
get(*terms, **override_kwargs)[source]

Allows for quick access to a specific term or terms from a FASTPT function.

list_available_functions()[source]

Returns a list of valid FASTPT functions.

list_available_terms()[source]

List all available power spectrum terms that can be requested via get()

load(file_path, load_dir=None)[source]

Load a saved output file and return it in the same format as FASTPT outputs (tuple of numpy arrays)

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – Name or path of the file to load

  • load_dir (str, optional) – Directory to load file from. If None, uses default output directory If file_path already includes a directory, load_dir is ignored.

Returns:

A tuple of numpy arrays matching the original FASTPT function output format

Return type:

tuple

run(function_name, save_type=None, save_dir=None, output_dir=None, **override_kwargs)[source]

Runs the selected function from FASTPT with validated parameters.

Parameters:

  • function_name (str) – Name of the FASTPT function to run

  • save_type (str, optional) – Type of file to save results as (‘txt’, ‘csv’, or ‘json’). Defaults to None.

  • save_dir (str, optional) – Directory to save results in. Defaults to the class’s output_dir.

  • output_dir (str, optional) – Alternative name for save_dir (for backwards compatibility).

  • **override_kwargs – Additional parameters to pass to the FASTPT function

Returns:

Result from the FASTPT function call

save_output(result, func_name, type='txt', output_dir=None)[source]

Save the output to a file

Parameters:

  • result – The result to save

  • func_name (str) – Name of the function that produced the result

  • type (str) – File type (‘txt’, ‘csv’, or ‘json’)

  • output_dir (str, optional) – Directory to save the file in. Defaults to self.output_dir.

show_cache_info()[source]

Display cache information

update_default_params(**params)[source]
update_fastpt_instance(fastpt_instance: FASTPT)[source]
